New Records: Domantas Sabonis' 28 rebounds were the most by a Celtics opponent since Ben Wallace in March 2002.
Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis recorded 28 rebounds and 23 points on 10-of-15 shooting.
DeMar DeRozan scored 24 points for the Kings.
Malik Monk contributed 22 points for the Kings.
Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 28 points.
Kristaps Porzingis added 22 points and 10 rebounds for the Celtics.
Jayson Tatum had a double-double with 15 points, 12 rebounds, and 5 assists but also committed 8 turnovers.
The Kings outscored the Celtics by 17 points in the fourth quarter.
Devin Carter hit back-to-back threes to open the fourth quarter for the Kings.
Keegan Murray's three-pointer stretched the Kings' lead to 15 points, prompting some Celtics fans to leave early.
Post-Match Reflections: Celtics head coach Joe Mazzulla emphasized the need for better execution and defense.
Jaylen Brown acknowledged the team's defensive collapses and the need to improve.
Kristaps Porzingis expressed confidence in the team's ability to bounce back despite recent struggles.
Joe Mazzulla praised the Kings' performance under interim head coach Doug Christie.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings were playing without their injured leading scorer De’Aaron Fox.
The Celtics shot 26.8% from three-point range as a team.
The Celtics have been dealing with a higher volume of injuries compared to last season.
The Celtics are 8-7 over their last 15 games and trail the first-place Cleveland Cavaliers by 6.5 games in the Eastern Conference.
